title: Decibel Level of Sound Formula
text: We can use the decibel level of sound formula. The loudness level, D, measured in decibels, of a sound of intensity, I, measured in watts per square inch is $$D=10*\log_{10}\left(\frac{I}{{10}^{\left(-12\right)}}\right)$$.
speech: We can use the decibel level of sound formula. The loudness level, D, measured in decibels, of a sound of intensity, I, measured in watts per square inch is    d is equal to 10 times the log base 10 of parentheses fraction,   i over, 10 raised to the parentheses negative 12  power   .

text: Plug in the value for the intensity level, I.

title: Simplify the Logarithm
text: We see log{10**(-2)/10**(-12)}. We can simplify the expression insid ethe logarithm, noting that $$\frac{x^a}{x^b}=x^{a-b}$$. What is $$\frac{{10}^{\left(-2\right)}}{{10}^{\left(-12\right)}}$$ simplified?
speech: We see log{10**(-2)/10**(-12)}. We can simplify the expression insid ethe logarithm, noting that  fraction, x to the a-th, over, x to the b-th,  is equal to x raised to the a minus b power . title: Simplify the Logarithm

subHints.title: Convert to Exponential Form
subHints.text: We know that we're trying to solve $$x=\log_{10}\left({10}^{10}\right)$$. Rewrite this expression first into exponential form.

title: Solve for D
text: Now, we have $$D=10\times10$$. What is D?
